# The `Timer` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This class is used to track the amount of time spent between invocations of its <a href="#aa8c887576ec3b0d68c10ebf4097c367c">startTimer()</a>/stopTimer() methods. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::Timer</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

This class is used to track the amount of time spent between invocations of its <a href="#aa8c887576ec3b0d68c10ebf4097c367c">startTimer()</a>/stopTimer() methods.

Given appropriate OS support it can also keep track of the RSS of the program at various points. By default, the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timer">Timer</a> will print the amount of time it has captured to standard error when the last timer is destroyed, otherwise it is printed when its <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timergroup">TimerGroup</a> is destroyed. Timers do not print their information if they are never started.

Definition at line 81 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/timer-h">Timer.h</a>.

### startTimer() {#aa8c887576ec3b0d68c10ebf4097c367c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void Timer::startTimer ()">
Start the timer running.

Time between calls to startTimer/stopTimer is counted by the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timer">Timer</a> class. Note that these calls must be correctly paired.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/timer-h/#l00126">126</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/timer-h">Timer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/timer-cpp/#l00150">150</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/timer-cpp">Timer.cpp</a>.
